bugs.title: spellchecker.dictionary_path is missing, Firefox can't find a dictionary

bugzilla.short_desc: spellchecker.dictionary_path is missing, Firefox can't find a dictionary

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

Previous Firefox releases linked with system hunspell library, this had the advantage of using the system installed dictionaries. Now the only dictionary available is US English, no matter what locale the user is running  

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):

firefox-62.0-2.fc28.x86_64

How reproducible:

Always

Steps to Reproduce:
2. Install hunspell packages for Spanish (or any other non US language)
2. Run Firefox on a non US locale, for example 

  export LANG=es_VE.UTF-8
  firefox

3. Check the dictionaries available for spelling.

Actual results:

The only dictionary available is US English even when the UI is shown in Spanish.

Expected results:

When Firefox was built with system hunspell, all installed dictionaries were always available, with any UI language being shown.

Additional info:

Commit 688bd9b12e42b7982a1443516d8c5a1aa423b50e [1] removed the support for building with system hunspell, don't know if this a technical readon or a mistake, but it downgrades the user experience for multi language users. Recently released Thunderbird 60 stil have the old behavior, the system hunspell dictionaries are used.

[1] https://src.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/firefox.git/commit/?h=f28&id=688bd9b12e42b7982a1443516d8c5a1aa423b50e
Ondrej, can you please check if the dictionaries work for you and if we can enable the system hunspell? Thanks.
With firefox-62.0-2.fc27.x86_64, I find that I am once again able to use the system dictionaries if I set preference spellchecker.dictionary_path = "/usr/share/myspell".

(In reply to Peter Oliver from comment #2)
> With firefox-62.0-2.fc27.x86_64, I find that I am once again able to use the
> system dictionaries if I set preference spellchecker.dictionary_path =
> "/usr/share/myspell".

Thanks a lot, that may be the actual issue here.
Added to firefox-62.0-3.
Ran into the same problem but firefox-62.0-2.fc29 (got it straight from koji) fixes it. thx!

comment.text: This version has been running normally.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Firefox 62.0.2 is available. Firefox 62.0 is available in the stable repos. 62.0.2 contains a Security Fix!

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
62.0.2

Actual results:
Firefox 62.0 is available in the stable repos.

Expected results:
Firefox 62.0.2 should be available in the stable repos.

Additional info:
Security Fix:
https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2018-22/
--> CVE-2018-12385

Release Notes:
- Unvisited bookmarks can once again be autofilled in the address bar (bug 1488879)
- WebGL rendering issues (bug 1489099)
- Updates from unpacked language packs no longer break the browser (bug 1488934)
- Fix fallback on startup when a language pack is missing (bug 1492459)
- Profile refresh from the Windows stub installer restarts the browser (bug 1491999)
- Properly restore window size and position when restarting on Windows (bugs 1489214 and 1489852)
- Avoid crash when sharing a profile with newer (as yet unreleased) versions of Firefox (bug 1490585)
- Do not undo removal of search engines when using a language pack (bug 1489820)
- Fixed rendering of some web sites (bug 1421885)
- Restored compatibility with some sites using deprecated TLS settings (bug 1487517)
- Fix screen share on MacOS when using multiple monitors (bug 1487419)
- Various security fixes

(In reply to JayJayJazz from comment #0)
> Description of problem:
> Firefox 62.0.2 is available. Firefox 62.0 is available in the stable repos.
> 62.0.2 contains a Security Fix!

Thanks for reporting. Minor updates with security fixes are easily missed.

firefox-62.0.2-1.fc28 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 28. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-d64cb04921

(In reply to JayJayJazz from comment #4)
> Martin is building right now: firefox-62.0.2-3

That build can be released later as it contains some experimental stuff.

(In reply to Martin Stransky from comment #5)

> > Martin is building right now: firefox-62.0.2-3
> 
> That build can be released later as it contains some experimental stuff.

Ok, thanks for the info. Do you need any feedback on this stuff?

(In reply to JayJayJazz from comment #6)
> (In reply to Martin Stransky from comment #5)
> > (In reply to JayJayJazz from comment #4)
> > > Martin is building right now: firefox-62.0.2-3
> > 
> > That build can be released later as it contains some experimental stuff.
> 
> Ok, thanks for the info. Do you need any feedback on this stuff?

Sure, you can check if the browser starts fine and also if remote works (open a new firefox window when there's already a running firefox instance).

Thanks.

(In reply to Martin Stransky from comment #10)
> 
> Sure, you can check if the browser starts fine and also if remote works
> (open a new firefox window when there's already a running firefox instance).
> 
> Thanks.

I tested with a fully patched (stable repos) Fedora 28 (in this case: LXQT spin) and your firefox-62.0.2-3 from koji. Firefox is starting fine. Also new windows can be opened successfully, even when already an instance of Firefox is up and running.

Browing is also working fine. I will also add a small attachment, which contains the about:support information.

Created attachment 1489026
about:support information
